channel.title: Buzzing on The Wall Street Journal
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: The U.S. deputy Treasury secretary warned against helping Russian oligarchs evade sanctions: “To those considering assisting these elites in hiding their ill-gotten wealth: We will find you” https://t.co/NCsWs6gYye
The theatrical release of best picture winner “CODA” was applauded for its use of on-screen captions. Deaf viewers want more movie distributors and theaters to follow suit. https://t.co/HMoqdKwcEw
The Ukrainian president lambasted timidity of European Union governments over refusal to target Russian energy trade https://t.co/QgqivYD0md

“I was out of line and I was wrong.” Will Smith apologized to Chris Rock for slapping him at the Oscars as the Academy announced a formal investigation into the incident #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/xPcvbkCRPZ https://t.co/cbb9YXa4rw
The Justice Department has endorsed legislation forbidding large digital platforms like Amazon and Google from favoring their own products and services over competitors’ https://t.co/10nIsfdVOg
Will Smith apologized to Chris Rock for slapping the comedian at the Oscars Sunday: “My behavior at last night’s Academy Awards was unacceptable and inexcusable." https://t.co/1NenEgIsZm
FedEx founder Fred Smith is stepping down as CEO of the company he started more than 50 years ago. President Raj Subramaniam will take over the role. https://t.co/xeiwBZmYBj
The Academy is considering consequences for Will Smith after he slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars. They could include revoking his award. https://t.co/1gQ2yIFZoz
A giant set of leaked documents give a look deep inside the workings of a pro-Russia hacking collective. And the twist: The documents were released by a Ukrainian. https://t.co/M2AMiQfqU9
Billionaire Elon Musk said he is “giving serious thought” to creating a new social media platform https://t.co/P5Kzwa5u0w

From @WSJopinion: If the world wants peace and a secure Europe, then it shouldn’t impose a settlement on Ukraine that ignores lessons from places where Russia got the endgames it demanded, writes Thomas D. Grant https://t.co/5n78Fk1s5R

Florida Republican Gov. Ron DeSantis signed into law a bill restricting teaching about sexual orientation and gender identity in public schools that has triggered divisive national debate. The measure takes effect July 1. https://t.co/KennFHgJSh
Will Smith has apologized to Chris Rock for slapping the comedian at the Oscars: “My behavior at last night’s Academy Awards was unacceptable and inexcusable." https://t.co/CmlxroOjFl
Goldman Sachs CEO David Solomon, who occasionally moonlights as an electronic dance musician, will perform at the Lollapalooza music festival in July, the festival announced https://t.co/bLcBmkOKUG
Taylor Swift is getting an honorary doctoral degree in fine arts from New York University, and will speak to the class of 2022 at the school’s graduation ceremony https://t.co/TCNBxVlswt

A Ukrainian internet service provider used by the country’s military suffered a massive cyberattack on Monday, Ukrainian officials said, fueling fears that Russia intends to wield more dangerous digital weapons as the war drags into its second month https://t.co/45jMLSvHiX

Chris Rock didn’t tell the joke about Jada Pinkett Smith during Oscars rehearsals and it didn't appear on the teleprompter during the ceremony, people close to the production said https://t.co/c7qfmiYJJ2

Canada is on the path toward delivering child care to households at a daily cost of 10 Canadian dollars, or the equivalent of $8, after approving on Monday a landmark plan for subsidized child care https://t.co/6Kumyl64Ba

The Supreme Court of Honduras ruled unanimously that former President Juan Orlando Hernández should be extradited to the U.S. and face trial in New York on charges he helped smuggle tons of cocaine in exchange for millions of dollars in bribes https://t.co/G7JfaQIGAp

A historic meeting of U.S., Israeli and Arab diplomats concluded with the group pledging to work more closely on security and economic ties, and promising to make this once-unthinkable gathering a regular event. https://t.co/0FtkBMwvJP
The Jan. 6 panel wants to talk to Virginia Thomas about texts to Trump’s chief of staff urging him to press to overturn the election, a person familiar said https://t.co/bNUET37hfx
Breaking: The Academy is considering consequences for Will Smith after he slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars. They could include revoking his award. https://t.co/Pnj0dGpAa0
Former President Donald Trump and adviser John Eastman more likely than not committed a felony in efforts to block the 2020 election result, a federal judge said https://t.co/zJYsDV41qV
Russia fired a volley of missiles at several cities across Ukraine overnight as negotiators prepared to hold face-to-face talks in Turkey to end more than a month of war https://t.co/nkwqDPteYJ
On her second shot at a directing Oscar, Jane Campion triumphed with her tense Western “The Power of the Dog.” She is the first woman to ever compete in the category twice. https://t.co/t7OHkW2sFH

The Pentagon is sending six Navy jet fighters that specialize in electronic warfare to Germany to help bolster defenses in NATO’s eastern flank, a senior Pentagon official said https://t.co/HmXZQrHJTL

Russia enriches more uranium than any other country. Now, soaring prices amid the war in Ukraine have triggered proposals to revive production of the critical fuel for nuclear plants in the U.S. #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/6o27h5WXMi https://t.co/UqIhfVGZrX
Billionaire Elon Musk said he is “giving serious thought” to creating a new social media platform, without disclosing specifics https://t.co/9geBtcC9gh
President Biden released a $5.8 trillion budget seeking a substantial increase in defense spending, as the U.S. aids Ukraine in its fight against Russia's invasion https://t.co/4YzSUPhb1W
After an Oscar night that made every trophy an afterthought, Will Smith went on to celebrate his best actor win while the Internet exploded with commentary about the slap https://t.co/VPL4NTTtdk

Former World Bank chief Kristalina Georgieva knew about a top official’s sexual misconduct but failed to take any action, according to current and former bank staff. Now, he is the top candidate to be Costa Rica’s next president. https://t.co/fiy4JjddwY

Russian oligarch Roman Abramovich and Ukrainian peace negotiators suffered symptoms of suspected poisoning after a meeting in Kyiv earlier this month, people familiar with the matter said https://t.co/uuf16onHCu

The Oscars ceremony was defined by the moment when Will Smith smacked comedian Chris Rock after he made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith’s hair #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/6fbLcrB1wS https://t.co/HtsDToazB5
Prosecutors have been advancing a tax probe of Hunter Biden, with a grand jury hearing a witness in February about past drug use and spending habits of the president’s son https://t.co/hiWbCTIwsq

Will Smith slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars after the comedian made a joke about his wife’s hair. Jada Pinkett Smith has been open about alopecia. Here's what to know about the condition. https://t.co/gaUquOf69u
Sanctions could make it more difficult, but not impossible, for Russia to sell some of its gold to raise money while its invasion of Ukraine continues https://t.co/7G6e5BY9Pg
The White House is set to release its multitrillion-dollar budget for fiscal year 2023, including a proposal to levy new taxes on the wealthiest Americans https://t.co/JtjSzQqTt7
Jessica Chastain wins best actress for her role as Tammy Faye Bakker in “The Eyes of Tammy Faye” at the #Oscars https://t.co/ie9aEPjfp4
Apple TV+ became the first streaming service to win best picture for its film “CODA,” introducing Apple as a serious Hollywood player https://t.co/Pj3FzPhrYT

Billie Eilish and Finneas O’Connell won best original song for their theme to the James Bond film “No Time To Die.” Boasting some of the most muscular vocals Eilish has recorded, the song started with a demo the siblings made on their tour bus. https://t.co/xvuunKSqkv
Will Smith won best actor for his portrayal of Richard Williams, the father and coach of tennis stars Venus and Serena Williams in “King Richard” at the #Oscars https://t.co/wmtgVCsshW
Actor Will Smith appeared to strike presenter Chris Rock in the face on the Oscars stage after a joke about Smith’s wife, Jada Pinkett Smith https://t.co/g5g6p2pR9J

In an #Oscars year rich with high-quality and incredibly popular music–both in original songs, scores, and hot pop singles–it is fitting that the best documentary feature is a music doc, Ahmir “Questlove” Thompson’s “Summer of Soul” https://t.co/jxx9gkr0LP
In the 50 years since "The Godfather" premiered, its themes, characters and filmmaking style continue to influence hit shows #Oscars https://t.co/GAtlBRVsmy

"Encanto" wins best animated feature film at the #Oscars. The film's song, "We Don't Talk About Bruno," which was written by Lin-Manuel Miranda, was dubbed in 46 languages and rose to the top of the Billboard’s Streaming Songs chart. https://t.co/AgvEDAFqg2
At the #Oscars, Greig Fraser won for best cinematography. His visuals for “Dune” conjured the desert planet Arrakis and helped lure moviegoers back to theaters last fall. https://t.co/BO8Sl4R7LI
The award for best supporting actor went to Troy Kotsur for his role in “CODA.” He is the first deaf male actor ever to be nominated and to win an Oscar. https://t.co/zvdgdJHrLc

“Drive My Car,” the mournful Japanese film about a theater director coping with the death of his wife, directed by Ryusuke Hamaguchi and based on a story by Haruki Murakami, won best international film at the #Oscars https://t.co/ZtMW8CJ5zR
It's important to adjust your workouts when you hit 50. Here are some exercises to help keep you strong and safe into the decades to come. https://t.co/SxJRh0YW29
Actor Sean Penn has vowed to melt down his Oscar statuettes if Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky isn’t invited to speak at the Academy Awards ceremony. https://t.co/cUclmicYAv
